channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ University of Texas at Dallas on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: A Neural Network Approach for Efficiently Answering Most Probable Explanation Queries in Probabilistic Models
item.description: A novel neural network efficiently answers arbitrary Most Probable Explanation (MPE) queries in large probabilistic models, eliminating the need for slow inference algorithms.

item.title: Continual Audio-Visual Sound Separation
item.description: ContAV-Sep: a novel approach to continual audio-visual sound separation, effectively mitigating catastrophic forgetting and improving model adaptability by preserving cross-modal semantic similarity a…

item.title: IQA-EVAL: Automatic Evaluation of Human-Model Interactive Question Answering
item.description: IQA-EVAL: An automatic evaluation framework uses LLMs to simulate human-AI interactions and evaluate interactive question answering, achieving high correlation with human judgments.

item.title: SEL-BALD: Deep Bayesian Active Learning for Selective Labeling with Instance Rejection
item.description: SEL-BALD tackles the challenge of human discretion in active learning by proposing novel algorithms that account for instance rejection, significantly boosting sample efficiency.

item.title: STONE: A Submodular Optimization Framework for Active 3D Object Detection
item.description: STONE: A novel submodular optimization framework drastically cuts 3D object detection training costs by cleverly selecting the most informative LiDAR point cloud data for labeling, achieving state-of-…
